segment.source: Guidelines for background tasks
segment.target: Guidelines for background tasks

segment.source: Ensure your app meets the requirements for running background tasks.
segment.target: Ensure your app meets the requirements for running background tasks.

segment.source: Guidelines for background tasks
segment.target: Guidelines for background tasks

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Ensure your app meets the requirements for running background tasks.
segment.target: Ensure your app meets the requirements for running background tasks.

segment.source: Background task guidance
segment.target: Background task guidance

segment.source: Consider the following guidance when developing your background task, and before publishing your app.
segment.target: Consider the following guidance when developing your background task, and before publishing your app.

segment.source: CPU quotas: Background tasks are limited by the amount of wall-clock usage time they get based on trigger type.
segment.target: CPU quotas: Background tasks are limited by the amount of wall-clock usage time they get based on trigger type.

segment.source: Most triggers are limited to 30 seconds of wall-clock usage, while some have the ability to run up to 10 minutes in order to complete intensive tasks.
segment.target: Most triggers are limited to 30 seconds of wall-clock usage, while some have the ability to run up to 10 minutes in order to complete intensive tasks.

segment.source: Background tasks should be lightweight to save battery life and provide a better user experience for foreground apps.
segment.target: Background tasks should be lightweight to save battery life and provide a better user experience for foreground apps.

segment.source: See Support your app with background tasks for the resource constraints applied to background tasks.
segment.target: See Support your app with background tasks for the resource constraints applied to background tasks.

segment.source: Manage background tasks: Your app should get a list of registered background tasks, register for progress and completion handlers, and handle those events appropriately.
segment.target: Manage background tasks: Your app should get a list of registered background tasks, register for progress and completion handlers, and handle those events appropriately.

segment.source: Your background task classes should report progress, cancellation, and completion.
segment.target: Your background task classes should report progress, cancellation, and completion.

segment.source: For more info see Handle a cancelled background task, and Monitor background task progress and completion.
segment.target: For more info see Handle a cancelled background task, and Monitor background task progress and completion.

segment.source: Use BackgroundTaskDeferral: If your background task class runs asynchronous code, make sure to use deferrals.
segment.target: Use BackgroundTaskDeferral: If your background task class runs asynchronous code, make sure to use deferrals.

segment.source: Otherwise your background task may be terminated prematurely when the Run method completes.
segment.target: Otherwise your background task may be terminated prematurely when the Run method completes.

segment.source: For more information, see Create and register a background task.
segment.target: For more information, see Create and register a background task.

segment.source: Alternatively, request one deferral, and use async/await to complete asynchronous method calls.
segment.target: Alternatively, request one deferral, and use async/await to complete asynchronous method calls.

segment.source: Close the deferral after the await method calls.
segment.target: Close the deferral after the await method calls.

segment.source: Update the app manifest: Declare each background task in the application manifest, along with the type of triggers it is used with.
segment.target: Update the app manifest: Declare each background task in the application manifest, along with the type of triggers it is used with.

segment.source: Otherwise your app will not be able to register the background task at runtime.
segment.target: Otherwise your app will not be able to register the background task at runtime.

segment.source: For more information, see Declare background tasks in the application manifest.
segment.target: For more information, see Declare background tasks in the application manifest.

segment.source: Prepare for app updates: If your app will be updated, create and register a ServicingComplete background task (see SystemTriggerType) to help perform app updates that may be necessary outside the context of running in the foreground.
segment.target: Prepare for app updates: If your app will be updated, create and register a ServicingComplete background task (see SystemTriggerType) to help perform app updates that may be necessary outside the context of running in the foreground.

segment.source: Request to execute background tasks:
segment.target: Request to execute background tasks:

segment.source: Important Starting in Windows 10, apps are no longer required to be on the lock screen in order to run background tasks.
segment.target: Important Starting in Windows 10, apps are no longer required to be on the lock screen in order to run background tasks.

segment.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps can run all supported task types without being pinned to the lock screen.
segment.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps can run all supported task types without being pinned to the lock screen.

segment.source: However, apps must call RequestAccessAsync before registering any type of background task.
segment.target: However, apps must call RequestAccessAsync before registering any type of background task.

segment.source: This method will return BackgroundAccessStatus.Denied if the user has explicitly denied background task permissions for your app in the device's settings.
segment.target: This method will return BackgroundAccessStatus.Denied if the user has explicitly denied background task permissions for your app in the device's settings.

segment.source: Background task checklist
segment.target: Background task checklist

segment.source: The following checklist applies to all background tasks.
segment.target: The following checklist applies to all background tasks.

segment.source: Associate your background task with the correct trigger.
segment.target: Associate your background task with the correct trigger.

segment.source: Add conditions to help ensure your background task runs successfully.
segment.target: Add conditions to help ensure your background task runs successfully.

segment.source: Handle background task progress, completion, and cancellation.
segment.target: Handle background task progress, completion, and cancellation.

segment.source: Do not display UI other than toasts, tiles, and badge updates from the background task.
segment.target: Do not display UI other than toasts, tiles, and badge updates from the background task.

segment.source: In the Run method, request deferrals for each asynchronous method call, and close them when the method is done.
segment.target: In the Run method, request deferrals for each asynchronous method call, and close them when the method is done.

segment.source: Or, use one deferral with async/await.
segment.target: Or, use one deferral with async/await.

segment.source: Use persistent storage to share data between the background task and the app.
segment.target: Use persistent storage to share data between the background task and the app.

segment.source: Declare each background task in the application manifest, along with the type of triggers it is used with.
segment.target: Declare each background task in the application manifest, along with the type of triggers it is used with.

segment.source: Make sure the entry point and trigger types are correct.
segment.target: Make sure the entry point and trigger types are correct.

segment.source: Write background tasks that are short-lived.
segment.target: Write background tasks that are short-lived.

segment.source: Background tasks are limited to 30 seconds of wall-clock usage.
segment.target: Background tasks are limited to 30 seconds of wall-clock usage.

segment.source: Do not rely on user interaction in background tasks.
segment.target: Do not rely on user interaction in background tasks.

segment.source: Re-register your background tasks during app launch.
segment.target: Re-register your background tasks during app launch.

segment.source: This ensures that they are registered the first time the app is launched.
segment.target: This ensures that they are registered the first time the app is launched.

segment.source: It also provides a way to detect whether the user has disabled your app's background execution capabilities (in the event registration fails).
segment.target: It also provides a way to detect whether the user has disabled your app's background execution capabilities (in the event registration fails).

segment.source: Do not specify an Executable element in the manifest unless you are using a trigger that should be run in the same context as the app (such as the ControlChannelTrigger).
segment.target: Do not specify an Executable element in the manifest unless you are using a trigger that should be run in the same context as the app (such as the ControlChannelTrigger).

segment.source: Check for background task registration errors.
segment.target: Check for background task registration errors.

segment.source: If appropriate, attempt to register the background task again with different parameter values.
segment.target: If appropriate, attempt to register the background task again with different parameter values.

segment.source: For all device families except desktop, if the device becomes low on memory, background tasks may be terminated.
segment.target: For all device families except desktop, if the device becomes low on memory, background tasks may be terminated.

segment.source: If an out of memory exception is not surfaced, or the app does not handle it, then the background task will be terminated without warning and without raising the OnCanceled event.
segment.target: If an out of memory exception is not surfaced, or the app does not handle it, then the background task will be terminated without warning and without raising the OnCanceled event.

segment.source: This helps to ensure the user experience of the app in the foreground.
segment.target: This helps to ensure the user experience of the app in the foreground.

segment.source: Your background task should be designed to handle this scenario.
segment.target: Your background task should be designed to handle this scenario.

segment.source: Windows: Background task checklist for lock screen-capable apps
segment.target: Windows: Background task checklist for lock screen-capable apps

segment.source: Follow this guidance when developing background tasks for apps that are capable of being on the lock screen.
segment.target: Follow this guidance when developing background tasks for apps that are capable of being on the lock screen.

segment.source: Follow the guidance in Guidelines and checklist for lock screen tiles.
segment.target: Follow the guidance in Guidelines and checklist for lock screen tiles.

segment.source: Make sure your app needs to be on the lock screen before developing it as lock screen-capable.
segment.target: Make sure your app needs to be on the lock screen before developing it as lock screen-capable.

segment.source: For more info see Lock screen overview.
segment.target: For more info see Lock screen overview.

segment.source: Make sure your app will still work without being on the lock screen.
segment.target: Make sure your app will still work without being on the lock screen.

segment.source: Include a background task registered with PushNotificationTrigger, ControlChannelTrigger, or TimeTrigger and declare it in the app manifest.
segment.target: Include a background task registered with PushNotificationTrigger, ControlChannelTrigger, or TimeTrigger and declare it in the app manifest.

segment.source: Make sure the entry point and trigger types are correct.
segment.target: Make sure the entry point and trigger types are correct.

segment.source: This is required for certification, and enables the user to place the app on the lock screen.
segment.target: This is required for certification, and enables the user to place the app on the lock screen.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the archived documentation.
segment.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the archived documentation.
